meanings.definition: Not able to be broken or destroyed.
meanings.sent1: The diamond was so infrangible that even the strongest hammer couldn't shatter it.
meanings.sent2: The ancient castle walls were infrangible, standing strong against the test of time.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's shield was so infrangible that even lasers bounced off it harmlessly.
meanings.sent4: Her spirit was as infrangible as a fortress, resilient against any adversity.
meanings.sent5: The bond between the two friends was infrangible, unbreakable by any disagreement.

meanings.definition: Incapable of being violated or infringed upon.
meanings.sent1: The strict rules of the library were infrangible, ensuring silence at all times.
meanings.sent2: The confidentiality agreement was infrangible, protecting sensitive information.
meanings.sent3: The cat's determination to catch the laser pointer was infrangible, despite its elusive nature.
meanings.sent4: His principles were as infrangible as a mountain, unwavering in the face of temptation.
meanings.sent5: The law of gravity is infrangible, keeping us grounded on Earth.
